```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(knitr)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(leaflet)
data(ChickWeight)
?title
```

Visit this [page](https://stat.ethz.ch/R-manual/R-devel/library/datasets/html/ChickWeight.html) for more information on this dataset in R.

[**Let's make a table that show the average weight of chicks based on their type of diet.**]{style="color:sienna"}
```{r echo=TRUE}
ChickWeight %>%
  group_by(Diet) %>%
  summarise(
    "Mean Weight" = round(mean(weight, na.rm = TRUE), 2)
)%>%
      kable(caption = 'Table 1. A knitr kable displaying the chicks average weight (g) per diet.')
```

[**Now, let's make another table that show the maximum and minimum weight of a chick over the course of their diet.**]{style="color:sienna"}
```{r echo=TRUE}
ChickWeight %>%
  filter(Time > 0) %>%
  group_by(Diet) %>%
  summarise(
    "Min Weight" = min(weight, na.rm = TRUE),
    "Max Weight" = max(weight, na.rm = TRUE)
)%>%
      kable( caption = "Table 2. A knitr kable displaying the maximum and minimum weight (g) of a chick based on their diet type.")
```

[**We can now make a linear model that analyzes the relationship of a chick's weight based on the amount of days it has been since birth. **]{style="color:sienna"}
```{r echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
fig_lm_weight <- lm(weight ~ Time * Diet, data = ChickWeight)

ggplot(ChickWeight, aes(x = Time, y = weight, color = Diet)) +
  geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.5) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, linetype = "dashed") +
  labs(
    x = "Time (days)",
    y = "Weight (grams)",
    color = "Diet",
    caption = "Figure 1. Linear model of a chick's weight (g) vs time (days).", fig.align = 'center',
) +
theme_classic() +
  theme(
    plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5)
  )

ggsave("fig_linearmodel_weight.png", width = 6, height = 4, dpi = 300)
```

[**Let's make a boxplot that shows the relationship between diet and weight**]{style="color:sienna"}
```{r boxplot, echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, results='hide'}
png("fig_boxplot_weight.png", width = 6, height = 4, units = "in", res = 300)

fig_weight_diet <- boxplot(weight ~ Diet, data = ChickWeight,
                           col = "pink",
                           xlab = "Diet",
                           ylab = "Weight (grams)")
mean_weight <- tapply(ChickWeight$weight, ChickWeight$Diet, mean)
points(1:length(mean_weight), mean_weight, col = "lightgreen", pch = 19)
mtext("Figure 2. Boxplot of the relationship between the chick's diet and weight (g).",
      side = 1, line = 4, cex = 0.8)

dev.off()

fig_weight_diet <- boxplot(weight ~ Diet, data = ChickWeight,
                           col = "pink",
                           xlab = "Diet",
                           ylab = "Weight (grams)")
mean_weight <- tapply(ChickWeight$weight, ChickWeight$Diet, mean)
points(1:length(mean_weight), mean_weight, col = "lightgreen", pch = 19)
mtext("Figure 2. Boxplot of the relationship between the chick's diet and weight (g).",
      side = 1, line = 4, cex = 0.8)
```

[**We can now make a histogram of the chick's weight categorized by their diets**]{style="color:sienna"}
```{r histogram, echo=TRUE, results='hide', message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
png("fig_histogram_weight.png", width = 6, height = 4, units = "in", res = 300)

fig_weight_hist <- hist(ChickWeight$weight,
                            xlab = "Weight (grams)",
                            col = "skyblue",
                            border = "black",
                            main = "")
mtext("Figure 3. Histogram of chick's weight (g) based upon their diet type.",
      side = 1, line = 4, cex = 0.8)

dev.off()

fig_weight_hist <- hist(ChickWeight$weight,
                            xlab = "Weight (grams)",
                            col = "skyblue",
                            border = "black",
                            main = "")
mtext("Figure 3. Histogram of chick's weight (g) based upon their diet type.",
      side = 1, line = 4, cex = 0.8)
```
